html.body:

Up-> CppAD Install InstallWindows
CppAD-> Install Introduction AD ADFun multi_thread library cppad_ipopt_nlp Example preprocessor Appendix
Install-> InstallUnix pkgconfig InstallWindows
InstallWindows
Headings-> Cygwin Download ---..Subversion ---..Web Link ---..Unix Tar Files Getting Started Introduction Examples and Testing More Correctness Testing Printing During Forward Mode CppAD Speed Test Double Speed Test Speed Utility Example
Windows Download and Test
Cygwin
If you are using Cygwin, or MinGW with MSYS, follow the unix install instructions.
Download
Subversion
If you are familiar with subversion, you may want to follow the more complicated subversion download instructions instead of the ones below.
Web Link
If you are not using the subversion download instructions, sure you are reading the web based version of this documentation by following the link web version . Then proceed with the instruction that appear below this point.
Unix Tar Files
The download files below were first archived with tar and then compressed with gzip. The ascii files are in Unix format; i.e., each line ends with a line feed (instead of a carriage return and line feed as is standard for windows formatted files). Visual Studio can handel this formatting just fine, but you may want to convert the format to the windows standard if you are using and editor that has trouble viewing the files in Unix format. and then a line feed.
CPL License cppad-20111219.cpl.tgz
GPL License cppad-20111219.gpl.tgz
The following steps will decompress and extract the files using Winzip version 7.0 (other version of Winzip and other decompression programs will be similar).
Download your choice between these two licenses listed above and store the result in a file on disk.
Open the file using Winzip (using All archives) as the file type in the Open browser.
Winzip will ask if it should decompress the file into a temporary folder and open it. Respond by selecting the Yes button.
Now select the Extract button from the main menu.
Place the name of the directory were you want the distribution in the Extract to field and then select the Extract button in the pop-up dialog. Winzip will create a subdirectory called cppad-20111219 where the files are placed.
Getting Started
The following steps will build the get_started.cpp example. Using Microsoft Visual C++, open the workspace
cppad-20111219\introduction\get_started\get_started.sln
in Visual Studio and then select Build | Build get_started.exe. Then in a Dos box, and in the cppad-20111219 directory, execute the following command
introduction\get_started\Debug\get_started
Introduction
The following steps will build the routines that verify the calculations in the exp_apx calculations in the Introduction section. Using Microsoft Visual C++, open the workspace
cppad-20111219\introduction\exp_apx\exp_apx.sln
in Visual Studio. Then select Build | Build exp_apx.exe. Then in a Dos box, and in the cppad-20111219 directory, execute the following command
introduction\exp_apx\Debug\exp_apx
Examples and Testing
The following steps will build an extensive set of examples and correctness tests. Using Microsoft Visual C++, open the workspace
cppad-20111219\example\example.sln
in Visual Studio. Then select Build | Build Example.exe. Then in a Dos box, and in the cppad-20111219 directory, execute the following command
example\Debug\example
More Correctness Testing
Using Microsoft Visual C++, open the workspace
cppad-20111219\test_more\test_more.sln
in Visual Studio and then select Build | Build test_more.exe. Then in a Dos box, and in the cppad-20111219 directory, execute the following command
test_more\Debug\test_more
Printing During Forward Mode
Using Microsoft Visual C++, open the workspace
cppad-20111219\print_for\print_for.sln
in Visual Studio. Then select Build | Build print_for.exe. Then in a Dos box, and in the cppad-20111219 directory, execute the following command
print_for\Debug\print_for
CppAD Speed Test
Using Microsoft Visual C++, open the workspace
cppad-20111219\speed\cppad\cppad.sln
in Visual Studio. Then select Build | Build cppad.exe. Then in a Dos box, and in the cppad-20111219 directory, execute the following commands
speed\cppad\Debug\cppad correct 123 speed\cppad\Debug\cppad speed 123
Double Speed Test
Using Microsoft Visual C++, open the workspace
cppad-20111219\speed\double\double.sln
in Visual Studio. Then select Build | Build double.exe. Then in a Dos box, and in the cppad-20111219 directory, execute the following commands
speed\double\Debug\double correct 123 speed\double\Debug\double speed 123
Speed Utility Example
Using Microsoft Visual C++, open the workspace
cppad-20111219\speed\example\example.sln in Visual Studio. Then select Build | Build example.exe. Then in a Dos box, and in the cppad-20111219 directory, execute the following command
speed\example\Debug\example
Input File: omh/install_windows.omh
